imp.core.commands.joints

Class RevoluteCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • imp.core.commands.joints.BaseJointCommand
      • imp.core.commands.joints.RevoluteCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Command

    public class RevoluteCommand
extends BaseJointCommand
    Class used to represent a Revolute Joint.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RevoluteCommand

        public RevoluteCommand(java.lang.String jointName,
               java.lang.String bodyNameBefore,
               java.lang.String bodyNameAfter,
               Point origin,
               Point commonAxis,
               Point bodyAxisFirst,
               Point bodyAxisSecond)
                throws SelfLoopException
        Throws:
        SelfLoopException

      • RevoluteCommand

        public RevoluteCommand(java.lang.String jointName,
               java.lang.String bodyNameBefore,
               java.lang.String bodyNameAfter,
               Point origin,
               Point commonAxis,
               Point bodyAxisFirst,
               Point bodyAxisSecond,
               java.lang.String type)
                throws SelfLoopException
        Method for inputting data for the execute.
        Parameters:
        jointName - The name of the revolute joint to add data to.
        bodyNameBefore - The name of the first body attached by this joint.
        bodyNameAfter - The name of the second body attached by this joint.
        origin - The origin point of the joint.
        commonAxis - The common axis between the two systems.
        bodyAxisFirst - The point along the x axis of the first body.
        bodyAxisSecond - The point along the x axis of the second body.
        Throws:
        NullParameterException - Thrown if any parameters are null.
        SelfLoopException - Thrown if the command attempts to create a joint linking a body to itself.
        InvalidParameterException - Thrown if any parameters are invalid for a revolute joint.

    • Method Detail

      • CreateXPin

        public static RevoluteCommand CreateXPin(java.lang.String jointName,
                         java.lang.String bodyNameBefore,
                         java.lang.String bodyNameAfter,
                         Point origin,
                         Point bodyAxisFirst,
                         Point bodyAxisSecond)
                                  throws NullParameterException,
                                         SelfLoopException,
                                         InvalidParameterException
        Create a XPIN command
        Parameters:
        jointName - The name of the revolute joint to add data to.
        bodyNameBefore - The name of the first body attached by this joint.
        bodyNameAfter - The name of the second body attached by this joint.
        origin - The origin point of the joint.
        bodyAxisFirst - A point along the x-axis of the first body.
        bodyAxisSecond - A point along the x-axis of the second body.
        Throws:
        NullParameterException - Thrown if any parameters are null.
        SelfLoopException - Thrown if the command attempts to create a joint linking a body to itself.
        InvalidParameterException - Thrown if any parameters are invalid for a revolute joint.

        Create a YPIN command
        Parameters:
        jointName - The name of the revolute joint to add data to.
        bodyNameBefore - The name of the first body attached by this joint.
        bodyNameAfter - The name of the second body attached by this joint.
        origin - The origin point of the joint.
        bodyAxisFirst - A point along the y-axis of the first body.
        bodyAxisSecond - A point along the y-axis of the second body.
        Throws:
        NullParameterException - Thrown if any parameters are null.
        SelfLoopException - Thrown if the command attempts to create a joint linking a body to itself.
        InvalidParameterException - Thrown if any parameters are invalid for a revolute joint.

        bodyNameBefore - The name of the first body attached by this joint.
        bodyNameAfter - The name of the second body attached by this joint.
        origin - The origin point of the joint.
        bodyAxisFirst - A point along the z-axis of the first body.
        bodyAxisSecond - A point along the z-axis of the second body.
        Throws:
